result.execSummary:
The defendant Victor M. Davis was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take >$500 - $5000) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: to Rock Co. case 14CF452 and any other

miscConds.notes: Provide DNA sample.  Undergo any counseling/treatment per agent to include Criminal Thinking.  AODA/treatment per agent.  NO contact w/Lake Delton Walmart.

If probation/extended supervision revoked or discharges with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

DE waives atty. for today's hearing.  DE will have paid by Nov.  State talked to agent - dept. is requesting a civil judgment.  State not asking for extension now, withdraw motion.  Court will deny extension and if not paid will be civil judgment.
Probation review hearing on October 3, 2022 at 09:00 am.
